intro: Cycnium ajugifolium, commonly known as the Mexican devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, angular stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Cycnium ajugifolium is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and historical use in traditional medicine.
